intro: [WRONG START] Rubus longiforns, commonly known as the long-fruited blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits composed of small, dark purple to black drupelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and thickets. The fruit is edible, though typically consumed fresh or used in jams and preserves.
